title: Unsecured Grafana instance on https://monitoring.prow-canary.k8s.io/dashboards
content:
Hi,
I was looking at https://monitoring.prow-canary.k8s.io Grafana webapp. I'm not sure if it is for demo purposes, but I can access the main dashboard and view all graphs.
https://monitoring.prow-canary.k8s.io/dashboards
If indeed it is for demo purposes, please let me close the report myself.
looking forward to hearing from you
Thank you
Impact
access charts on various server resource usage.
steps: Navigate to https://monitoring.prow-canary.k8s.io/dashboards in a web browser.
Observe that the Grafana dashboard is accessible without authentication, displaying various server resource usage charts.
vuln_description: The Grafana instance at monitoring.prow-canary.k8s.io is publicly accessible without authentication, allowing anyone to view server resource usage charts and potentially sensitive monitoring data.
reason: This vulnerability involves no complex interactions or state manipulations. It is simply a case of an unsecured web application being publicly accessible, which is straightforward to discover by accessing the URL.

authnz_metadata.reason: The report describes an unsecured Grafana instance that allows public access to dashboards without authentication. This falls under the AuthN/AuthZ Bypass vulnerability class, where no authentication is required to access resources that should be protected. The methodology described involves testing for such vulnerabilities by attempting to access resources with unauthenticated sessions or with sessions from less privileged users. Since the Grafana instance is openly accessible, it would be detected by step d) of the methodology, which tests actions with unauthenticated user sessions.
